West Kootenay Prefixes - Know where you are calling.

The most common area code is 250, followed by 778 and 236.

223 Boswell
225 Riondel
226 Winlaw/Vallican
227 Crawford Bay/Gray Creek
229 Balfour/Ainsworth
229 Procter/Harrop
265 Nakusp
269 Fauquier

352 354 505 509 551 777 825 NELSON

Garage, Moving & Yard Sales

  • GARAGE SALE: Aug. 31-Sept. 2, 7539 Upper Balfour Rd, furniture, antiques, tools, collectables, etc.

    Liveload Ad

  • GARAGE SALE: Saturday, September 7, 9am-3pm, 915 Glendale Ave, Salmo. A little bit of everything!

    Regular Ad

  • MONDAY, AUGUST 26 THROUGH THURSDAY, AUGUST 29: 9am-noon, 402 West Richards, Nelson. Used building materials, office equipment, etc. Kalein Hospice Centre.

    Regular Ad

  • MULTI-FAMILY YARD SALE: 5585 Hoodikoff Rd, Winlaw (just past Sissies), Sat/Sun, Aug. 31, Sept. 1. 9am-3pm (no early birds please). Old horse drawn equipment, farm equipment, tools, books, collectibles, National Geographics (1920-1970's), woodwork tools, planer/jointer, etc. 12' kayak, much more.

    Regular Ad

Events

  • 'PUGS & CROWS' at the Argenta Hall Sunday, Sept. 8. Doors 6:30, Show 7pm. Sliding Scale: $5-$10. This is a rare opportunity to see what is happening with original music in Vancouver. The Pugs and Crows were awarded the JUNO for Instrumental Album of the Year for 2013, come find out why!

    Liveload Ad

  • 'HARP PIXIE' CD RELEASE CONCERT: Silence Becomes Song. Langham, Kaslo, Friday, Sept. 6, 7:30pm. Harp, Dawna McLennan; Cello, Jeff Faragher; Dance, Erin Parsley; and Vocals, Dawna McLennan & Allison Girvan. Columbia Basin Trust.

    Regular Ad

  • ALL WELCOME! THE LARDEAU VALLEY SUNDAY MARKET 10am-2pm each Sunday (except Aug. 4) until Sept. 22. Live entertainment, prizes, local produce, local artists, and more and more and more..... Beside Drifters on Hwy 31 in Meadow Creek. Info? lvmarketcoordinator@gmail.com or links@lardeauvalley.com

    Regular Ad

  • ARE YOU SHAVING FOR PLAYOFFS? :0) Mountain Mayhem Roller Derby Playoffs Sept. 8, 3pm. 4 finals: 3rd place vs 4th place; 1st place vs 2nd place! More info at at www.kootenayrollerderby.com

    Regular Ad

  • AUDITIONS: 7pm, Sept. 9, St. Andrews Church, Alley Entrance, Eldorado St, Trail. Columbia Phoenix Players. Phone 250-362-7325.

    Regular Ad

  • CORRECTION TO PENNYWISE AUGUST 20 TOAD FEST EDITORIAL, page 38. We regret that we published the wrong time for the Wednesday, August 28 event. Please note that the times on Wednesday are from 10 am to 1 pm. Sorry for any inconvenience.

    Regular Ad

  • HARROP HARVEST FESTIVAL, SUNDAY, SEPT. 15: Planning your garden? Plan ahead! Vendors of vegetables, fruit, plants, crafts, food, please take note. Also, Buskers, reserve your space early. Call 250-229-4740..

    Regular Ad

  • IT'S ALMOST THAT TIME AGAIN! Slocan Valley Fall Fair, Sept. 8. Start planning your entries for the fair. Info, call Carey, 250-226-7702 or winlawhall@live.com

    Regular Ad

  • IT'S GARLIC TIME AGAIN! Hills Garlic Festival Sunday Sept. 8, 10am-5pm in New Denver at Centennial Park. Garlic, produce, crafts, food. Live entertainment by Mountain Station, Motes & Oats, Flydini the Magician, Visions Alive Puppetry. CONTESTS: Heaviest Garlic Head, Biggest Clove, Best Garlic Braid, Best Garlic Poem. Admission $4, children 12 and under free. Absolutely NO DOGS please. www.hillsgarlicfest.ca

    Regular Ad

  • JOIN BC AUTHOR AND ORGANIC GARDENING GURU, Carolyn Herriot, Wednesday Sept. 4 at 10am for a discussion about the joy and importance of sustainable eating at St. Andrew's United Church Hall. This free event is brought to you by The Kootenay Library Federation, Kaslo & District Public Library and the North Kootenay Lake Community Services Society Food Security Project. For more info, 250-353-2942.

    Regular Ad

  • MAIN STAGE GALLERY RETIREMENT SALE: Closing Sunday, Sept. 1. Up to 70% off. Main Street, Rossland, 250-362-9505.

    Regular Ad

  • NELSON CIVIC THEATRE invites fans of independent cinema to its Thursday Night Movie at 7:30pm. The other opening days are Friday-Sunday and Cheap Tuesdays, and will mostly feature two different movies. Check for details www.civictheatre.ca or call 250-352-5833.

    Regular Ad

  • ROYAL CANADIAN SEA CADETS OPEN SHIP NIGHT: Sept. 10th, 5-8pm for all youth ages 12-18. Introduction to the Sea Cadet program with food and drinks and meet with Officers and other youth in the program. Trail Armory, 1990 Seventh Ave. Trail. Please contact Captain Llora McTeer for more information: 131sea@cadets.gc.ca, 250-367-6263.

    Regular Ad

  • STILL EAGLE'S FIRST SIDEWALK SALE ON BAKER ST! Sale racks inside and outside, 30%-80% off outside, no tax inside! Aug. 30-Sept. 2, 9am-8pm.

    Regular Ad

  • TRAINING "EXPAND THE BOX” WITH CLINTON CALLAHAN. Let the BOX no longer be your limit. Reclaim your attention, your center, your dignity, the energy and wisdom of your feelings and your clarity. Become more yourself in ways you might never have imagined possible. Aug. 30-Sept. 1, $200-$600 sliding scale plus meals. Nelson, 250-226-7051..

    Regular Ad

  • TWIN RIVERS CHORALE: First practice, Thursday, Sept. 12, 7pm at St. Peter Lutheran Church. 713-4 St., Castlegar.

    Regular Ad

  • WELCOME VENDORS TO PASS CREEK FAIR: Sept. 21 & 22, applications@passcreekfair.com 250-365-6885.

    Regular Ad

Craft Fairs

  • AFFAIR ON MAINSTREET, METALINE FALLS, WA: Saturday, August 31 & Sunday September 1. Arts & crafts, quilt show, car show, train rides and more.

    Regular Ad

  • NOW ACCEPTING APPLICATIONS for the CHRISTMAS CRAFT FAIRE SEASON. Christmas At The Grand (formerly Queen City Christmas Craft Faire) will now be held at the New Grand Hotel, Nelson, Nov. 15-16. And also accepting applications for Castlegar Christmas Craft Faire Dec. 8. Please contact Cathy, 250-359-7904.

    Regular Ad

Farmers Market

  • COME AND ENJOY THE HARROP FARMERS' MARKET!! Sundays, 10am-2pm. For information call 250-229-5370 or email kootenannyman@gmail.com

    Regular Ad

  • HARROP FARMERS' MARKET is looking for vendors and entertainers, until Sept 1. 250-229-5370, kootenannyman@gmail.com

    Regular Ad

  • HONEY FRESH FROM TERRY'S HONEY FARM, GRAND FORKS: Playmor Junction, Saturday mornings, 9am-noon, Aug. 24 & Sept. 7.

    Regular Ad

  • KASLO SATURDAY MARKET runs every Saturday June 8-Sept. 21, 10am-2pm in Front Street Park. Come find local produce, baking, Kootenay artisans and more. Contact kaslosaturdaymarket@gmail.com for vending opportunities.

    Regular Ad

  • LEGENDARY MEATS: Under new management as of September 1. Same Legendary quality. Same Legendary service. Hours of Operation: Tuesday-Saturday, 9-6. Sunday/Monday by appointment only.

    Regular Ad

  • THE SALMO VALLEY FARMER'S MARKET AGM & Celebration will be held Saturday, Sept. 7, at the market grounds from 3-5:30pm. Come to provide your input and support for our market and stay for a corn roast and live music.

    Regular Ad
